intro: Hemizygia linearis, commonly known as the narrowleaf hemizygia, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb with slender, linear leaves that are often arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are small and clustered in a head, resembling those of other members of the daisy family. Hemizygia linearis is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
